title: Command economies, more govt resource ownership

content.question: Command economies differ from capitalist economies mainly because of which of the following?

choices.label: Command economies have higher prices for oil.
Capitalist economies have higher prices for oil.
Command economies have higher degree of government ownership of resources.
Capitalist economies have higher degree of government ownership of resources.
Command economies rely on prices to allocate resources.

content.answer: Command economies have higher degree of government ownership of resources.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe the similarities, differences, and limitations of economic concepts, principles, or models.
